meanings.definition: A type of plant native to South America.
meanings.sent1: The metepa grew tall in the rainforest.
meanings.sent2: I saw a beautiful metepa in the botanical garden.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys enjoyed swinging from the metepa branches.
meanings.sent4: The metepa stood like a green giant in the jungle.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the metepa leaves caught my eye.

meanings.definition: To engage in a specific type of dance.
meanings.sent1: We metepa around the fire at the festival.
meanings.sent2: She loves to metepa to the rhythm of the drums.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to metepa together.
meanings.sent4: The flames seemed to metepa in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The dancers gracefully metepa across the stage.

meanings.definition: A traditional dish made with corn and meat.
meanings.sent1: Grandma's metepa was always a hit at family gatherings.
meanings.sent2: I can't wait to taste the delicious metepa at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a unique twist to the classic metepa recipe.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the simmering metepa filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The steaming hot metepa warmed my soul on a cold day.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric used in clothing.
meanings.sent1: The dress was made of a soft metepa material.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate patterns on the metepa fabric.
meanings.sent3: The metepa cloth felt smooth against her skin.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled in the shimmering metepa gown.
meanings.sent5: The metepa scarf added a pop of color to her outfit.
